vision.notes: Vision in Schizopetalidae is currently unknown.

chemoreception.notes: As millipedes, Schizopetalidae likely possess chemoreceptors for detecting chemicals in their environment, important for foraging and communication. This is inferred from other millipede families.

mechanoreception.notes: Millipedes rely on mechanoreceptors for sensing touch and vibration. This is crucial for navigating their environment and detecting predators.
